titleStmt.title: Description of University of Pennsylvania Ms. Codex 1052: Hebrew Bible

availability.licence: These images and the content of Kislak Center for Special Collections, Rare Books and Manuscripts Ms. Codex 1052: Hebrew Bible are free of known copyright restrictions and in the public domain. msIdentifier.repository: Kislak Center for Special Collections, Rare Books and Manuscripts

supportDesc.extent: 398 leaves : 214 x 144 (176 x 118 with commentary, 124 x 94 Bible text only) mm. bound to 215 x 158 mm

collation.p: Parchment, 398; 1¹⁰(-1), 2-39¹⁰, 40¹⁰(-1); [1-398]; contemporary foliation, upper left recto, mostly trimmed away and only occasionally visible; modern foliation in pencil, lower left recto. Catchwords on the last verso of each gathering.

layoutDesc.layout: Written in 2 columns of 30 lines; ruled in faint ink; commentary surrounds Bible text.

origin.p: Written in Italy, possibly Modena, circa 1480 (Yarnall Library catalog).

history.provenance: Ownership note at beginning of text suggests that the manuscript was owned by a descendant of Nehemiah of Modena (f. 1r). Another note, difficult to read, follows the Bible text, and may include the signature Abraham Judah, son of Yehiel of Camerino (f. 396r).
Formerly owned by the Yarnall Library of Theology, St. Clement's Church (Philadelphia, Pa.); acquired by the Yarnall Library before 1933.
Deposited with the Yarnall Library of Theology at the University of Pennsylvania, 1974.
